data.title: Remove extra letter-spacing from keybindings in watermark on Windows & Linux
data.body: Only OSX uses icon-like characters for the keys and benefits from extra letter-spacing. From #12716, CC: @bpasero @bgashler1

data.title: Multi-line Next Match Selection (Cmd+D)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3 - OS Version: OSX Yosemite 10.10.5 I'd like to request multi-line selection matching (ala Sublime). Right now, if you have a code snippet like this, you would only be able to match-next if your selection spans a single line (i.e. `

`): ```

Test Word 1

Test Word 2

Test Word 3

``` It's really useful to be able to do a multi-line match-next, as in: ```

Test ```

data.title: VSCode fails to open file when another instance of VSCode is already running as "Administrator" user.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Pro x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Run VSCode as Administrator (Right click on icon, select "Run As Administrator")
2.  Right click on any file, select "Open with Code"
3. Nothing happens: no new instance of VSCode created with selected file opened nor selected file opened in running instance.

data.title: Menus do not always initialise correctly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode several times
2. Note that sometimes entire menus are missing from the menu bar, e.g., "File" or "Help" is completely absent.

data.title: Autocomplete/syntax & type validation performance is horrendous in 1.5.3
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open two files
2. Declare a class in one file
3. Use that class incorrectly in the other file (e.g., non-existent member access)
4. Note the squiggly line
5. Correct the error
6. Wait 60 seconds for VSCode to update the squigglies

Also:
1. Do steps 1-2 above
2. Type something something "dot"
3. Wait ages for autocomplete to pop up, observe the text "Loading..."

data.title: VS Code node debugger stuck on: Debugger listening on [::]:[port]
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.3
- OS Version:Windows 7

Unsure how to reproduce the issue. I think I somehow got the debugger in a bad state. It was working before on my environment but vs code threw an error while debugging that I could not make sense of and after that I started experiencing this bug. I am trying to fix the issue by debugging a very simple js file.

Test.js:
`console.log("test");`

launch.json:

```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "fix debugger",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/test.js",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "preLaunchTask": null,
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--nolazy"
            ],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "console": "externalTerminal",
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null
        }
    ]
}
```

When i run the debugger this is all I get before it gets stuck:
![debuggerstuck](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5614600/18956590/f13da46c-8629-11e6-9bae-06c4f8af413f.png)

I already attempted re-installing the application to see if that would fix it but no luck.

data.title: Can't edit file after git revert
data.body:
![selection_015](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/760983/18956531/a0d2582c-8653-11e6-9459-ab7988621bc8.png)
- VSCode Version:1.5.3
- OS Version: Fedora 23

When I git-revert a file, it can't be edited.  File appears in tab, but selecting that tab doesn't update the body from the previously selected file.  

In attached screenshot, .ts file tab is selected, but shows .scss content (and typing updates the latter)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Edit a file
2. revert with VSC git tool

Workaround:

Restart VSC (reopening file doesn't work)

data.title: Keep scroll position stable when closing a tab in the tab well
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open many files so that tabs are scrollable, have the first (left-most) tab active
2. scroll to the farthest (right-most) tabs
3. close a tab in that area
4. the whole tab bar scrolls back to the left-most position (active tab)

This leads to loss of focus and confusion. If I want to close multiple tabs there, I have to scroll to them each time I close one.

data.title: [loc][Query][VSCode] the string Please clarify
data.body:
Hi, we have a question from our translator. Can you help please? Thanks!

Source:
Accessibility &&Options
Go to &&Symbol in File...
Go to Symbol in &&Workspace...
File Name:
src\vs\code\electron-main\menus.nls.resx
Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "miAccessibilityOptions"
".resx", 0; "miGotoSymbolInFile"
".resx", 0; "miGotoSymbolInWorkspace"
Query:
Could you please explain why there are two ampersands in the source string? Do we need to reflect it in the translation?    inho.chung  9/29/2016 10:48:17 AM

data.title: git.path doesn't work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 7 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set git path to: ``"git.path": "C:\\msys64\\usr\\bin\\git.exe",`
2. You get error `ENOENT: no such file or directory, lstat 'C:\c'`

Git is not in my path and I don't want it in my path because it brings along bash which is hindering with msys and so on.

data.title: File search (ctrl + E) should suggest more relevant options
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. From anywhere inside VSC, ctrl + E opens a dialog to search by file name. 
2. Start typing, list of options appear. 

Unfortunately, the options are not sorted by any relevance (recently opened, or files from folder currently working on). It would be great if this could be improved!

Example: 

I have 6 files open, all from a folder called .../userSettings/
I want to open a 7th file called main.js from that same folder so I type ctrl + E, "main.js"
I have a main.js file in a dozen different folders in my project, so I get a list of all the main.js from all my folders, but I would expect userSettings/main.js to be at the top of the list as I'm working on that folder. Failing that, it should still be at the top of the list because I worked on it an hour ago and closed it, and I'm reopening it again (having not worked on any other main.js from other folders in a while).

Hope this makes sense! Thanks
